review_content: Clear golden blonde pour with a thin white head and spots of lacing …. Aroma of sweet malts, caramel malt, some light floral notes, grape  and a little bit of lemon … taste is of the same, lemon, little floral, sweet caramel malts, grape and light bitter citrusy hops …. Drinks bigger than a regular lager …. Definitely see the German ingredients in this brew … sessionable little lager

Appearance: golden amber; slight head
Taste: decent light & malty
8/28/21 - 92 Town Korean Bbq (Schaumburg, IL); 22oz bottle

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 330 ml 

Aroma: nice, fresh, on dry side. You can feel macro vibe bit of good tones. Nice herbal hop character in background. 

Look: poured deep gold, clear with medium plus cap. Decent lace. 3+ 

Palate: medium thinner bodied, not as dry as aroma suggested. Average shorter finish. 

Taste: grainy with hint of skin apple, shallow watery pause behind. Mellow mild malty back.

Smell is light of malt...taste is a that malt that kinda tastes like light apple..
Thick mouthfeel, all malt with decent flavor, but one dimentional...not much to rate here...had at Korean restaurant 919 for lunch...food looks great... haven't tasted yet... pandemic winding down..~590,000 US deaths...
Rating copied from Untappd. Had while flying Asiana First Class from Seoul to Frankfurt on 8 dec 2018

Strong hoppy flavor. Bavarian style. Ok but not fantastic. Needs to be super cold.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured from 330mL bottle. Clear gold with white head. Light grain with a mild sweetness. Inoffensive lager.
Bottle. Tastes like dough, corn, grass, smooth and mild. Light body and low/medium carbonation. Smells like dough, grass, corn, and faint toffee.

Pours with a brilliant clear gold body and a moderate sized white head. Aroma-taste of grain and bread crust with a faint herbal background and a clean finish. Light-medium bodied with moderate carbonation.
Small can from a supermarket in Phnom Penh. Pours golden yellow with a dissipating white head. Aroma of malt. Hint of lemon in the sweet taste. Sweet finish.

33cl can from lucky supermarket, siem reap.
Thin white head.  Clear golden pour. Bland and watery

Clear light golden with a thin bubbly foamy white head. Light Lagery aroma that’s pale grainy and with a gently fruity ester. Crisp light body with nice carbonation with golden graininess and a gentle kiss of fruity esters and a light pale lagered finish. Clean and gently fruity and grainy.

330ml Flasche in London. Gelbes klares Bier. Flüchtiger Schaum. Getreideduft. Recht süss. Wo ist der Hallertauer Hopfen? Etwas korkig im Antrunk. Dann Getreide, Rosenblüte. Gibt üblere Biere in Asien.
Can from Charmies Liquor on 11 October 2019. This is your typical Pale Lager but I guess it’s okay for a quick Friday afternoon knock off beer.
Choi’s Craft Beer House, cafe in Busan, Korea. Getapt een beetje zoetig. Ik zou zeggen IPA achtig, geen tweede besteld.

Clear golden blonde pour with a thin white head and spots of lacing …. Aroma of sweet malts, caramel malt, some light floral notes, grape and a little bit of lemon … taste is of the same, lemon, little floral, sweet caramel malts, grape and light bitter citrusy hops ……
Appearance: golden amber; slight head Taste: decent light & malty 8/28/21 - 92 Town Korean Bbq (Schaumburg, IL); 22oz…
Bottle 330 ml Aroma: nice, fresh, on dry side. You can feel macro vibe bit of good tones. Nice herbal…

Smell is light of malt...taste is a that malt that kinda tastes like light apple.. Thick mouthfeel, all malt with decent flavor, but one dimentional...not much to rate here...had at Korean restaurant 919 for lunch...food looks great... haven't tasted yet...…
Rating copied from Untappd. Had while flying Asiana First Class from Seoul to Frankfurt on 8 dec 2018
Strong hoppy flavor. Bavarian style. Ok but not fantastic. Needs to be super cold.…
Poured from 330mL bottle. Clear gold with white head. Light grain with a mild sweetness. Inoffensive lager.
Bottle. Tastes like dough, corn, grass, smooth and mild. Light body and low/medium carbonation. Smells like dough, grass, corn, and faint toffee.

Pours with a brilliant clear gold body and a moderate sized white head. Aroma-taste of grain and bread crust with a faint herbal background and a clean finish. Light-medium bodied with moderate carbonation.
Small can from a supermarket in Phnom Penh. Pours golden yellow with a dissipating white head. Aroma of malt. Hint of lemon in the sweet taste. Sweet finish.

33cl can from lucky supermarket, siem reap.
Thin white head.  Clear golden pour. Bland and watery

Clear light golden with a thin bubbly foamy white head. Light Lagery aroma that’s pale grainy and with a gently fruity ester. Crisp light body with nice carbonation with golden graininess and a gentle kiss of fruity esters and a light pale lagered finish. Clean and…

330ml Flasche in London. Gelbes klares Bier. Flüchtiger Schaum. Getreideduft. Recht süss. Wo ist der Hallertauer Hopfen? Etwas korkig im Antrunk. Dann Getreide, Rosenblüte. Gibt üblere Biere in Asien.
Can from Charmies Liquor on 11 October 2019. This is your typical Pale Lager but I guess it’s okay for a quick Friday afternoon knock off beer.
Choi’s Craft Beer House, cafe in Busan, Korea. Getapt een beetje zoetig. Ik zou zeggen IPA achtig, geen tweede besteld.
Dégustée le 2019-08-19.                                                                                                                                             .
Bottle in a Santa Clara (CA) restaurant.The beer looks good but tastes very average. It suits the meal and that's all.

돈주고마실때는 저녁회식때일뿐일까
그래도 국산 페일라거중에서는 제일낫다.
홉피함이 약간느껴지는것이 장점.
최근 수입라거,필스너들이 점점 묽어지고있어서 상대적으로 맛있게 느껴짐

소주에 섞어도 맛있음.
Насыщенный и яркий желтый цвет. Пены и аромата почти нет. Вкус простой и плоский. Базовый лагер.
Bottles at a chicken place in Seoul. Pours a clear golden hue with a medium white head. A light grainy nose. Sweet, more big grains, a bit smooth but really just another pale lager.
Przyzwoity lager z wyraźną, chmielową goryczką. Nawet nie tak bardzo wodnisty.
Clean hay nose. Crystal clear golden, thick head. Metallic, barley malt, hay. Light body, easy carbonation.

Neus: mout & hooi
Uiterlijk: goudgeel bier met fijne witte schuimkraag
Smaak: zoetig, moutig, bitterig
Mondgevoel: licht, met droge afdronk.
Barley malt and hay aroma.  Golden yellow with small head.  Mildly sweet barley malt, and mildly bitter fresh hay flavor.  Okay body.  A pretty decent pale lager.
Flasche beim Koreaner. Keiner Rede wert. Malz im Aroma und Geschmack überdeckt jegliche weitere mögliche Geschmacks- und Aromarichtung.

[50cl bottle from a liquor store in Buena Park, CA.] After Beer52 delivered 10 beers that claimed to be South Korean, but weren't at all, it's good to find the real thing on a street corner in California.It's actually a reasonably made beer, but a bit on the sweet side for my taste; a straw coloured pour with a thick white head; cereal grain aroma with some grassy notes; sweet malty body with a light grassy bitterness and some limey citrus; and a sweet grainy finish.
C’est une bière très normal. L’arôme est légère mais ça me plaît. C’est bien mélangé

No expectations. Similar to Olympia. All malt and it actually tastes like it was crafted with some care. Smooth and silky mouthfeel. Crisp pilsner esq, would be a nice compliment to some spicy Korean food!
Burnt sugars and brown malty sugar. Clear gold with a small white head. Light and sweet with a clean finis.
The foamstability is low, body light. It smells sweet, malty. The taste is sweet, malty, sweet-malty, watery. A more sweet pale lager.
Passable as a beer. Still quite boring in all aspects. I’d still take this over most macro crap tho!
Poured from a bottle a clear pale gold color. Aroma is malt and some bread, lighter body with a taste of malt and bread. Not much of an aftertaste.

A 500 ml. can from Simple Mart down the road. Aroma: vegetables, slightly citric. Appearance: clear light amber, 2 mm. head. Palate: light-bodied and rather oily, average carbonation, bitter finish. Taste: medium-bitter, reassuring so. Some soap, lemon and unfortunately cardboard tussling for prominence in the background. Just about drinkable, but the name 'Kloud' ain't fooling anyone.
Quite ok for a Pale Lager. Some taste of grain, an idea of bitterness, but also some soapy elements. Better than some of its local peers, yet just about drinkable.

Bought at Simple Mart on Wuxing road. One for 48 or 2 for 95 lol. Big fluffy white head promises a lot. I definitely get malt on the nose, and some lemon. Good carbonation and lager colouring. Taste is sweet malt, a hint of grass and grain with a very faint hop. The malt is the abiding feature. Reminds me of a Japanese lager ( they pay premium tax for this much malt too). All the morons who proffer it is cardboard and metal are just wrong. It is not a standard lager at all. Much better than the average lager you'd find in a 7-11 and such.

3 3 3 2 6
Bottle shared in Cambodia. Clear golden with a white head. Aroma of malt, grain, cardboard and light hops. Flavour is above light sweet and light bitter. Light bodied with light to moderate carbonation.

Sampled on draught at my hotel in Itaewon, Seoul. Standard industrial lager. Malty taste which is slightly syrupy. There follows a hop flavour which has hints gooseberry and quite a lot of cardboard. Medium to thin mouthfeel. Not great. At least it came free.
12. oz. Six pack cans from local Korean market. Pours golden color, with white head which dissipates rather quickly. Taste is toast, a bit of hops, malts and grass. Basic cheap lager.
bottle oro limpida buona schiuma discreta persistenza cotto metallico abbastanza morbida non molto aromatica amaro contenuto
Shittest beer ever, a cheap German knock off, has nothing Korean, nor German about this beer at all. What a load of Shit.
Served in bottle at dak. Aroma is malty, bready, hint of apple. Taste is moderate malt, bare hint of hops. Light mouthfeel. Actually pretty good light lager.
Can in Seoul. Clear golden colour, small white head. Aroma has mostly fruity, papery pear. Light-bodied. Flavour has pear and cardboard. Useless imdustrial lager.

Bottiglia. Il gusto al naso è indirizzato verso l'orzo. L'intensità olfattiva è un timido profumo e la costanza olfattiva è corta. Il mantello birroso superiore non è molto persistente. La grandezza delle bollicine è medio-fine. Il liquido è di aspetto torbido. Bollicine medio-fini costituiscono la forma della frizzantezza. Il colore è giallo dorato brillante. Il corpo è snello. L'amaro è moderato. L'intensità gustativa è normale e si prolunga in modo appena percepibile. Le sensazioni boccali finali risultano di facile beva. Il finale è semplice e dissetante. Il retrogusto è appena percepibile. Sul tetto della bocca finiscono note di cereali.
50cl bottle at Momofuku DC, pours a clear dark gold with some clumpy, white head. Nose of honey, grist, dough, corn. Flavor has corn, flower petals, some metal. Finishes watery. What did you expect?

330ml bottle.
Light gold with good head.
Grainy aroma with a touch of Sulfur.
Grainy palate with slight oxidation.
Average.

Can. Light golden, small and mostly diminishing head. Light, malty - grainy, light corn and lightly sweetish aroma, light metal. Body is light, malty - lightly grainy and dryish - lightly sweetish flavor, light cardboard and light metal. Finish is short, malty - grainy, dryish - lightly sweetish, light cardboard and faint hoppyness, light metal. Watery lager with notes of sharp metal. Tastes really cheap.

Extreme clear golden color, good head. Malty smell. Aroma has malt, hay but also some dish soap. Very sweet. Weird taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can on Asiana flight from ICN to LAX. Light grassy hop nose with plenty of grain. Gold color, with a fluffy white head. Flavors of grain, malt extract, a very thin fruity note, and minimal bitterness. Thin^medium body. Innocuous lager. Edging toward bad... but, considering the distance to a beer bar (at 35,000 feet in the air), it is drinkable.
From bottle in shaker. Pours clear golden, both head and aroma are modest. Sweet taste with faint hops lost under malt in the finish. A decent partner to Korean BBQ.
Tastes like white out that was rubbed off a newspaper. A good degree of foulness. Bottle.
Bottle. Pours clear golden, small white head, minimal lacing. Aroma is corn, malty, grain. Flavor is light plus sweet, light bitter, corn, malty. Light body. Ew
Burk fixad av FunkyF. Klar ljusgul vätska. Brödig doft med ris. Vattnig smak med viss örtighet. Majs och ljust bröd.
Burk från kollega. Ljust gul med vitt skum. Doft av bröd och citrus. Ganska tråkig maltig smak.

Can from a Singapore convenience store. Poured a crystal clear straw colour with a fizzy, very short-lived bubbly white head. The aroma is grainy corn gluey, cardboard malt, light hop. The flavour is moderate to strong sweet with a sweet sugary toffee malt palate. Light bodied with lively carbonation.
330ml bottle, three months past the BB date. Pours dark gold with a medium-sized white head. Aroma is citrus, bread, grain. Taste is sweet, citrus, light bitter. Better than I expected.
Can from supermarket. Golden color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, toast, a bit of hops, malts and grass. Bitter finish with citrus, toast, malts, a bit of hops and grass. Basic bulk lager.

On tap at ICN airport 

Pours clear light golden with a medium sized off-white head that dissipates quickly, light lacing. Aroma is mild grains and bisquity. Flavor is grainy, bisquity and mild citrus 

Clean, not bad
330ml. bottle in Vientiane, Laos. Pours a clear golden yellow with a minimal head. Aroma of citrus, hay. Sweet malt taste, slightly lemony. Average pale lager.

A slight aroma of hay, a nearly clear appearance, and an overly light flavor that would lead one to believe this is more water than malt leads to an unimpressive beer. Like many of the Asian lagers, this has little substance to it; but there is nothing inherently offensive about it.
Pours a clear gold and has a white head. Smells like cereal. Taste is mildly sweet, fairly refreshing, clean ifnish, slightly creamy but light palate. Not bad for a standard lager.
Bottle shared by Joes. Clear golden color, small white head. Smell and taste malts, straw, decently bitter, lightly cardboard. Average body and carbonation. Drinkable though.

Bottle (330ml) in Brisbane. Sweet corn syrup plus cardboard aromas and flavours. Rather sickly. No hop presence to speak of. Unpleasant metallic finish. Pretty bad to be honest. Appears clear golden with a small white head.
On tap. Clear golden color with white head. Aroma - Bread, malt ,citrus. Taste - Lightly bitter, malt, biscuit, grain.
330ml klar und golden mit kleiner Schaumkrone. Leicht würzig und malzig. Leichter Körper.
Hated this when I had one in Vancouver, but was told to give it another try in Korea. Golden colour. On the nose, a bit of malts, touch of acetaldehyde but less than many other Korean ones.
From a bottle. Very smooth finish, not as bad as I’d expected with the travel to here and all.
Tap at Inchon. Decent malty nose, grainy, helles-like, light hops. Sweet and grainy, malty, touch of citrus. Medium body. A decent all-Malt lager for South Korea.
Bue en bouteille. Dégueulasse. Vieille bière de soif sur le malt. Aucun intérêt.

Bottle. Pours a clear golden color with a big foamy head. Aroma of corn syrup, caramel sweetness and bit of malt. Taste of caramel, malt and corn syrup. Fair bitterness and a sticky finish. Light body, not very well crafted. Similar to other Korean lagers with a bit more malt.

(Can) Pours clear golden yellow with short lived loose white head. Reasonable aroma - light malt, hints of candy and grass. Light body with reasonable carbonation. Taste is light malt with a hint of slightly metallic bitterness in the finish. It’s not great, but it does seem to be better than many mainstream South Korean beers.

12oz bottle at a local Korean restaurant. Poured a totally clear golden yellow color with a fluffy medium-sized head. Aroma was light corn, grain. Light sweet malts. Corn finish. Exactly what I expected.
Eh not much better than the other typical crappy Korean lagers. There is a little malt flavor and aroma but very weak with a metallic finish. I never buy this

500 ml bottle bought at Kofco on Castle Peak Road, Yuen Long.



Clear light golden yellow colour; Explosive three finger head with crumpet white foam which lasts for 3 minutes; Excellent sticky lacing with active carbonation; Fragrant aroma of full lager malt, with strong barley grains, light yellow fruits, floral, light molasses, strong bread, lemon peels and fresh grass; Medium sweet taste of fair lager malt, with barley grains, light floral, molasses, bread, light spices, light lemon, fair bitter hops and grass; Mid to light body. Thin but fairly slick palate; Mouth feel is fair maltyness in a thinned but quite slick background, Very grainy as well as a bit watery. No off-taste, flowery with moderate sweetness. Light spicy and bready with light lemon to round. Clean and easy!... Hoppiness is floral, lemon peels and fresh grass in nose. Light floral, light spices, light lemon and grass in taste; Bitterness is low for an abrupt, fair to light astringent malty finish; Slightly dry after taste. Grassy and easy to mouth.



Comments: Really have no expectation for this one, so I am quite pleased to see its impressive heads, neat malty and Hallertau-like aroma, plus a fairly malty taste with light spicy edges. Its down-side being too thin a mouthfeel and a little low on hops to be a Premium Lager but, as a Macro Pale, this is overachieving and nice to have. Pretty neat for what it is.

Taste: super crisp, biscuit, semi sweet malt behind the flavor, smooth, clean finish. Gentle grain nose. Lite Gold, crystal clear, with white head and lots of carbonation. Lite in body. Appetizer ale that"s more of a malty version of a Pilsner than Lager.
Dorada clara, limpia de escasa espuma. Oma escaso, cereal. En boca lager del montón, cereal también, tirando a dulce, nada que aportar. Un país más.

Pours clear straw color with a tight, 1-finger white head. Mild aroma, with notes of lemon and corn. Body is light, and a bit watery. Finish is brief and lightly dry. Lemony flavor with a bit of grass. A slightly sweet note at the back, maybe corn.

Pint at KFC in Seoul (of all places). It’s definitely at the more palatable end of the pale lager spectrum. There’s a far too creamy head but a nice citrus note in the body. 

 ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

330ml bottle into lager glass. Crystal clear golden amber beer with thin white head. high carbonation. Very faint malt nose. Good body, zingy with a bit of a bite when swallowed. Finish has bubblegum, grains, metal and late pepper. Not bad, a bit harsh. I’m intrigued by its blurb which claims a water free original gravity recipe. Water free beer?
Pours clear golden with low white head. Aroma of malt, bread, citrus. Taste is sweet with a mild citrus finish. Light and smooth body with soft carbonation.

0.5 L bottle bought randomly at H Mart. Clear, bubbly, straw color, with a big, foamy, white head. The aroma is wet grass, biscuit dough, light pine sap, tin can, and some earth. Sweet up front, with a relatively pleasant bitterness through the finish. Light body, sticky, grainy, and oily. This is a pretty awful pale lager.
Dåse. Hotel i Seoul. Ikke så dårlig som de andre makrolagere. Her kan man rent faktisk smage en snert af humle. Håber at prøve lidt mikrobryg i Beer craft Valley i morgen.

On tap @ Lotte City Hotel, Ulsan. Hey, I Didn’t expect anything else than a crystal clear pale golden one, and that’s exactly what I got. Smells like it should, a little metallic, corn, sweet. Soft dusty, yet not repulsive at all. Tastes just like it’s supposed to also. Metallic lagerish pale malts with lager yeast and a little hay sweetness. Thin as water soup in the mouth and it’s fizzing on the lagerbubbles. It doesn’t sound much, and it ain’t either but it definitely gets the job done! 24.06.2016

Aroma: grainy
 Appearance :light golden yellow bubbly white head which is quickly disappearing
taste
 Taste: sweetish taste 
 Palate : light body
Korean Lotte Beer

33 cl bottle from a convenience store, 2200 KRW (1.60 €), into a plastic glass. Pale yellow color, small fizzy and bubbly white head quickly disappearing. (where’s the rich&smooth foam??). Aroma of wet cardboard with a remainder of malts, earthy grains and some sugar. At least it’s a pure malt one. Some noble hops in the finish (label says Hallertau), sweetish taste, light body, short sticky finish. 5/1/3/2/7=1.8


50 cl bottle from Sonamuyaa restaurant into a proper glass this time. Taste as above. At least  the foam bursts up and has a decent persistence.. 5/3/4/2/8=2.2


On tap at Grill&Pub Lotte World. Extra cold, short creamy head, some persistence but no lacing, quite clean finish, vaguely dry. 5/3/4/2/9=2.3

Dose (50 cl) aus einem Supermarkt in Seoul. - Goldgelb, klar. - In der Nase süßlich-getreidige, schwach fruchtige Noten, eher Limonade als Bier. - Geschmack mild malzsüßlich mit deutlichen fruchtigen Noten. Durchschnittlich rezent, dünn. Im Abgang ein Minimum an unauffälliger Herbe. - Rund und nicht direkt unangenehm aber aromatisch schwach. Immerhin etwas besser als die fade Plörre der großen südkoreanischen Bierkonzerne.
Can. Golden lager, almost no foam. Aroma: malt, fruit, a little sour and floral hops. Taste: watery, malt, soda, fruity (aging?).

Her Name is Han, Manhattan bottle: pours golden with a white head. Aroma is corny and adjunctish and whatever. Tste is tolerable. It is not as watery and clear as some other Korean lagers. Some aftertaste thay is a bit grainy and the like. Not bad when pish comes to shove.

Many thanks to Erzengel for sharing! 


Pours clear golden colour with a small white head. Aroma of grain, pale malt, mild apples. Taste of dry pale malt, some hops, grains, watery.

Many thanks to Vincent for this can!  Grainy neutral beginning. A bit more bitterness than expected, round and fresh. The beer is easy to drink with grainy hints, but the aroma is quite good for a Pale Lager. Round and smooth grainy aftertaste with hints of bitterness. Not too bad!
Smell is damp hay, corn on the cob, bread, toast. Taste is actually really good. Balance sweetness, crisp and a little bitter, drying slightly. I expected way worse
Bottle. Clear bright yellow with small foamy white head, faint doughy aroma, high carbonation, slightly sweet malt taste, abrupt finish. Generic lager, decent.
Pour is golden, with a good cereal taste. Good when paired with Korean cuisine. Worth a try.
From the bottle the aroma is an ale, the taste is malty a little sweet and notes of soy sauce, finish is malts overall ok but not the the best
